{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2982744,"name":"Jacob Swigert","username":"Psych714","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/psych714/{size}/258612_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-21T15:17:51.450Z","cooked":"

My team repurposed an old robot into a simple tank drive. We re-imaged the Roborio, updated the SparkMax Firmware, and set the SparkMax’s to new IDs. When we use the run feature in the REV SparkMax Client, the motors move just fine. However, when we run the code we get these errors.

ERROR ﻿﻿ 4 ﻿﻿ [CAN SPARK MAX] IDs: 1, 2, WPILib or External HAL Error: CAN: Message not found Periodic Status 0 ﻿﻿ ﻿﻿﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ 1 ﻿﻿ CTRE CAN Receive Timeout ﻿﻿ frc.robot.Main.main(Main.java:23)

And when we use the joysticks to move the robot, we get these errors

ERROR ﻿﻿ 4 ﻿﻿ [CAN SPARK MAX] IDs: 1, 2, 3, 4, WPILib or External HAL Error: CAN: Message not found Periodic Status 0 ﻿﻿ ﻿﻿﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ 1 ﻿﻿ CTRE CAN Receive Timeout ﻿﻿ frc.robot.Main.main(Main.java:23)

We don’t know whether this is a code or a wiring issue. So, I have attached a zipped file with the code we are running and a video of the CAN wire connections.

TankDrive.zip (28.3 MB)

Psych714:

ERROR ﻿﻿ 4 ﻿﻿ [CAN SPARK MAX] IDs: 1, 2, 3, 4, WPILib or External HAL Error: CAN: Message not found Periodic Status 0

CAN SPARK MAX Errors Programming
Hi all, While testing my new basic drive train code on our new chassis, I encountered an error with our SPARK MAX. I deployed code to the robot successfully but I continuously got the errors in the RIO log: [CAN SPARK MAX] timed out while waiting for Periodic Status 0 [CAN SPARK MAX] WPILib or External HAL Error: CAN: Message not found. (In Driver Station, these same errors came up but with Error Codes of 2 and 4 attached, I’m not sure at the moment which was which). I updated all the SPAR…
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2021-12-21T17:25:34.661Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":71.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":398300,"topic_slug":"troubleshooting-cansparkmax-to-roborio-connection","display_username":"icemannie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/can-spark-max-errors/372881","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"CAN SPARK MAX Errors","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28240,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/troubleshooting-cansparkmax-to-roborio-connection/398300/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2982784,"name":"Will Toth","username":"Will_Toth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/will_toth/{size}/111117_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-21T18:04:23.159Z","cooked":"

Most likely a wiring issue. The video is a bit hard to follow (there is a bundle of connectors in the beginning that you skip over), but make sure you go green ↔ green and yellow ↔ yellow, and that all the connections are secure. If you still have issues, rewire the whole whole verifying that all of the connections (including cables, housings, etc) are secure.

Looking at 0:23 in the video it appears you have the connector backwards (though again its a bit hard to see)

Can you run 1 motor if you change you CAN wiring so only 1 is in the loop?

The fact that you also got the CTRE error implies it is likely a wiring issue. It looks as though the leg from the first controller to the second may be reversed.

Unfortunately, the wire connector is correct it just looks wrong in the video. We will try to rewire the whole thing now.

Update: The exposed wire wasn’t touching the metal on the wago connector. Everything works now, thanks everyone so much!

enabled","slug":"pigeon-2-0-thinks-robot-is-disabled-when-it-is-enabled","posts_count":2,"reply_count":0,"highest_post_number":2,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2025-02-22T03:09:41.765Z","last_posted_at":"2025-02-22T17:20:19.791Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-02-22T17:20:19.791Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"We The root cause was that both the canivore and the pigeon were being powered at 5V.
